info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 7:32PM MDT until August 27 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Missoula MT
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Idaho, including the following county, Lemhi.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/mso/hydrology
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Move away from recently burned areas. Dangerous flooding of creeks, roads and stream crossings is possible. The heavy rains could trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING
